customer_addr:
2844 Springs Lake Road
Lake Wales, FL 33898

citations.narrative:
Three dog enclosures are not providing the minimum required space for the size of dog that is currently being housed
there. The enclosures currently measure 24 inches by 30 inches which provides a total of 720 square inches or 5 square
feet of space.
- One adult female bully, "New New", measures 23 inches long and requires 841 square inches or 5.84 square feet of
space.
- One adult female bully, "Sirius", measures 23 inches long and requires 841 square inches or 5.84 square feet of space.
- One adult female bully, "Foxy", measures 22 inches long and requires 784 square inches or 5.44 square feet of space.
Not providing the minimum area of space does not allow for adequate freedom of movement and can lead to unnecessary
discomfort and distress for the animal. Each dog must be housed in a primary enclosure meeting the minimum amount of
floor space calculated as follows: (length of dog in inches + 6) x (length of dog in inches + 6) = required floor space in
square inches; required floor in inches/144 = required floor space in square feet. The licensee must ensure that primary
enclosures used to house dogs meet the required minimum amount of floor space.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by September 20, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Three dog enclosures are not providing the minimum required space for the size of dog that is currently being housed 
there. The enclosures currently measure 24 inches by 30 inches which provides a total of 720 square inches or 5 square 
feet of space.  
 
- One adult female bully, "New New", measures 23 inches long and requires 841 square inches or 5.84 square feet of 
space.  
- One adult female bully, "Sirius", measures 23 inches long and requires 841 square inches or 5.84 square feet of space.  
- One adult female bully, "Foxy", measures 22 inches long and requires 784 square inches or 5.44 square feet of space.  
 
Not providing the minimum area of space does not allow for adequate freedom of movement and can lead to unnecessary 
discomfort and distress for the animal. Each dog must be housed in a primary enclosure meeting the minimum amount of 
floor space calculated as follows: (length of dog in inches + 6) x (length of dog in inches + 6) = required floor space in 
square inches; required floor in inches/144 = required floor space in square feet. The licensee must ensure that primary 
enclosures used to house dogs meet the required minimum amount of floor space. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by September 20, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
